text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Zaire asked Zambia to bear with that country over the current border problems resulting from the civil war there.
- The Zambia Congress of Trade Unions called on the government to probe the managerial backgrounds of companies bidding for the assets of Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM)
- Nigeria suspended its technical assistance programme to Zambia to protest the Lusaka government's condemnation of its human rights record.

- Finance Minister Ronald Penza called for the deployment of troops in the northern Mpulungu district where hundreds of Zairean refugees have crossed the border, fleeing the war in their home country.
- The International Monetary Fund has given Zambia $14 million under the Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility.
- The government has dissolved the board of the state-run Zambia National Broadcasting Corp and appointed new officials in an effort to improve operations.
- The government accused some Zairean diplomats of using their diplomatic immunity to smuggle goods and people into Zambia.
- British-based off-the-road tyre company OTR Tyres will start operations in Zambia this month.
